perturbation.original_text: Eutectix and its operations, facilities and business shall at all times comply with all applicable federal, national, state, provincial and local laws (including common law), statutes, ordinances, orders, rules, codes, standards and regulations of the U.S.A., the country(ies) in which Eutectix or its operations or facilities are located, customs and export controls, and all other relevant jurisdictions (each individually a “Law” and collectively “Laws”), including without limitation Environmental Laws as defined below.
perturbation.changed_text: Eutectix and its operations, facilities and business will endeavor to comply with applicable federal, national, state, provincial and local laws (including common law), statutes, ordinances, orders, rules, codes, standards and regulations of the U.S.A., the country(ies) in which Eutectix or its operations or facilities are located, customs and export controls, and all other relevant jurisdictions (each individually a “Law” and collectively “Laws”), including without limitation Environmental Laws as defined below.
perturbation.explanation: Changing 'shall at all times comply' to 'will endeavor to comply' introduces ambiguity, potentially conflicting with stringent regulatory mandates. This modification implies that Eutectix might not always adhere to every law, opening the door for interpretation and possible non-compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: Various Environmental Laws and Regulations, Export control regulations

perturbation.original_text: Eutectix shall provide Liquidmetal with all information, certificates and records relating to the Liquidmetal Products (including Certificates of Origin) as necessary for Liquidmetal to: (a) fulfill any customs obligations, origin marking or labeling requirements, and certification or local content reporting requirements; (b) claim preferential duty treatment under applicable trade preference regimes; and (c) participate in any duty deferral or free trade zone programs of the country of import.
perturbation.changed_text: Eutectix will attempt to provide Liquidmetal with information, certificates, and records relating to Liquidmetal Products (including Certificates of Origin) to enable Liquidmetal to: (a) fulfill customs obligations, origin marking, or labeling requirements, and certification or local content reporting requirements; (b) claim preferential duty treatment under applicable trade preference regimes; and (c) participate in duty deferral or free trade zone programs of the country of import.
perturbation.explanation: Replacing 'shall provide' with 'will attempt to provide' weakens the obligation. The inclusion of 'to enable' suggests that Eutectix's responsibility is limited to merely providing information, not ensuring that Liquidmetal can successfully fulfill its obligations. This ambiguity creates uncertainty regarding the extent of Eutectix's duty and could lead to disputes over compliance.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Customs Regulations, Export Administration Regulations

perturbation.original_text: Eutectix shall warn, label, and ship such hazardous materials in accordance with Environmental Laws. Upon shipment and on an ongoing basis, Eutectix shall provide Liquidmetal with current Safety Data Sheets and all other information needed to comply with all Environmental Laws. Eutectix shall have no liability to or on behalf of Liquidmetal for any failure by Liquidmetal to comply with any Environmental Law.
perturbation.changed_text: Eutectix will use reasonable efforts to warn, label, and ship such hazardous materials in accordance with Environmental Laws. Eutectix will also endeavor to provide Liquidmetal with current Safety Data Sheets and other relevant information. Eutectix will not be liable to or on behalf of Liquidmetal for any failure by Liquidmetal to comply with any Environmental Law.
perturbation.explanation: Modifying 'shall warn, label, and ship' to 'will use reasonable efforts' and 'shall provide' to 'will also endeavor to provide' weakens the obligation for Eutectix to ensure safe handling and provide crucial information about hazardous materials. This creates ambiguity, as 'reasonable efforts' is open to interpretation and does not guarantee compliance with strict environmental and safety standards, especially under DOT regulations. The ambiguity undermines the clear mandate for providing accurate SDS and adhering to safety regulations, which could lead to violations and potential hazards.
perturbation.contradicted_law: U.S. Department of Transportation Hazardous Materials Regulations, OSHA Hazard Communication Standard
